author: W. Wordsworth (sample)
text: The river sings beneath a sky of listening hills; the wind keeps counsel with the trees.

author: R. Tagore (sample)
text: Let the forest be my temple, the green hush my prayer; leaves write psalms on the air.

author: W. Whitman (sample)
text: I befriend the grass, companion to clouds; the earth beats a brave and ancient heart.

author: E. Thoreau (sample)
text: In still water I meet myself; loons declare a freedom not measured by clocks.

author: S. Heaney (sample)
text: Bog-light remembers; a spade lifts history, wet with the breath of soil.

author: Eprene (sample)
text: The glacier speaks in silences; a blue ache opens where old winters slept.

author: Hafez (sample)
text: Garden and nightingales weave verses where dew is scripture and moonlight ink.

author: Akhtar Sherazi (sample)
text: Mountains kneel to morning; rivers untie their silver hair to bless the valley.
